verses.text: A \add good\add* name \add is\add* rather to be chosen than great riches, \add and\add* loving favor rather than silver and gold.
The rich and poor meet together: the LORD \add is\add* the maker of them all.
A prudent \add man\add* foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
By humility \add and\add* the fear of the LORD \add are\add* riches, and honor, and life.
Thorns \add and\add* snares \add are\add* in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower \add is\add* servant to the lender.
He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
Cast out the scorner, and contention shall end; yes, strife and reproach shall cease.
He that loveth pureness of heart, \add for\add* the grace of his lips the king \add shall be\add* his friend.
The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
The slothful \add man\add* saith, \add There is\add* a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
The mouth of strange women \add is\add* a deep pit: he that is abhorred by the LORD shall fall therein.
Foolishness \add is\add* bound in the heart of a child; \add but\add* the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
He that oppresseth the poor to increase his \add riches\add* , \add and\add* he that giveth to the rich, \add shall\add* surely \add come\add* to want.
Bow down thy ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thy heart to my knowledge.
For \add it is\add* a pleasant thing if thou keepest them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send to thee?
Rob not the poor, because he \add is\add* poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
Be not thou \add one\add* of them that strike hands, \add or\add* of them that are sureties for debts.
If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean \add men\add* .
